      • jobsIn7Days

        public boolean jobsIn7Days(java.util.Collection<Job> allJobs,
                           java.util.Calendar mydate)
                    throws MyOwnException
        Checking: if there during any consecutive 7 day period more than 5 jobs or not.
        Parameters:
        allJobs - is a list of all Jobs.
        mydate - is user entered date.
        Returns:
        false if there 5 or more jobs in 7 days, otherwise true.
        Throws:
        MyOwnException - if user are too busy for that week.

      • checkForPastDate

        public boolean checkForPastDate(java.util.Calendar futureJobDate)
                         throws MyOwnException
        Check if user entered date is in past or not.
        Parameters:
        futureJobDate - is a job's date.
        Returns:
        true if date is not past, otherwise throw new MyOwnException.
        Throws:
        MyOwnException - if entered date is in past.

      • checkForFutureDate

        public boolean checkForFutureDate(java.util.Calendar futureJobDate)
                           throws MyOwnException
        Check if user entered date is more than 90 days in future or not.
        Parameters:
        futureJobDate - is a job's date.
        Returns:
        true if date is not past, otherwise throw new MyOwnException.
        Throws:
        MyOwnException - if entered date is more than 90 days in future.
